definition: old character/archaic form of a Chinese character
ancient/old/paleo-
surname Gu
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: PROFIT-An archaic word no longer in use.
If nothing else, Cahill has a gift for bringing alive ancient characters.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有別的，卡希爾將有一個活着的古字的禮物。

sentences.english: Usually about other Gu words, or the transfer of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 通常對其他古字或轉移話題。

definition: see 篆書|篆书[zhuan4 shu1]
variant Chinese character
original form of a Chinese character
seal script used throughout the pre-Han period
oracle script/oracle bone character (an early form of Chinese script)
pictogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character derived from a picture/sometimes called hieroglyph
inscription in bronze/bell-cauldron inscription
the great seal/used narrowly for 籀文/used broadly for many pre-Qin scripts
pictogram/hieroglyph
component of a Chinese character (as the radical or the phonetic part)
ideogram (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/Chinese character indicating an idea, such as up and down/also known as self-explanatory character
seal (of office)/seal script (a calligraphic style)/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆/writing in seal script
nonstandard form of a Chinese character
loan character (one of the Six Methods 六書|六书 of forming Chinese characters)/character acquiring meanings by phonetic association/also called phonetic loan
phono-semantic compound character
